snippet: Boko Haram’s capacity to seize and hold entire towns is weakened, according to officials, though the group continues to carry out attacks on public places.
abstract: Nigerian authorities report significant progress in eradicating Boko Haram, though group continues to carry out terrorist attacks; coordinated effort between Nigeria and its neighbors aims to vanquish group by end of 2015, as promised by Pres Muhammadu Buhari.

byline.contributor: Moumine Ngarmbassa contributed reporting from N’Djamena, Chad, and Denis Nkwebo from Douala, Cameroon.

lead_paragraph: Boko Haram’s capacity to seize and hold entire towns is weakened, according to officials, though the group continues to carry out attacks on public places.

headline.main: Boko Haram Attacks Persist, but Nigerian Officials Say Group Is Losing Ground
headline.print_headline: Attacks Persist, but Nigerian Authorities Say Boko Haram Is Losing Ground
